importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when Prince Andrew allegedly emailed Jeffrey Epstein stating they were 'in this together', revealing continued contact and potentially undermining claims of cutting ties.
When Prince Andrew formally gave up all public duties and charity roles, marking a significant turning point in the royal family’s response to scandals involving him.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which Giuffre was allegedly trafficked by Epstein and the subsequent allegations of sexual encounters between Andrew and Giuffre emerged, leading to widespread public scrutiny and media coverage.

keyTakeAways: Prince Andrew was accused of asking a bodyguard to investigate Virginia Giuffre’s criminal record in 2011 to discredit her as a sexual assault accuser.
Giuffre, a victim of sex trafficking by Epstein, died by suicide in April 2025 at age 41, which intensified public attention on the allegations.
Andrew previously denied all allegations, including claims of a sexual relationship with Giuffre, and in 2022 settled a civil suit with her without admitting guilt.
The Metropolitan Police are investigating whether Andrew misused a close protection officer for a smear campaign, raising ethical and legal concerns about royal conduct.
The revelations come amid broader scrutiny of Andrew’s ties to Jeffrey Epstein and his failure to show empathy for victims, contributing to the House of Windsor’s efforts to distance itself from him.
British Energy Secretary Ed Miliband condemned the use of police officers in smear campaigns, calling the allegations deeply concerning and ethically wrong.

summaryOfNewsArticle: In October 2025, London police are investigating whether Prince Andrew, in 2011, asked a bodyguard to investigate Virginia Giuffre’s criminal record in an attempt to discredit her as a sexual assault accuser. The allegations come amid renewed scrutiny of Andrew’s long-standing ties to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and his failure to show empathy for victims. Giuffre, who was trafficked by Epstein in 2001 and died by suicide in April 2025, is central to the case. Although Andrew settled a civil suit with her in 2022 without admitting wrongdoing, he continues to deny all allegations. The investigation raises serious ethical concerns about the use of law enforcement personnel in smear campaigns. British Energy Secretary Ed Miliband condemned such actions as deeply inappropriate, and Giuffre’s family has urged King Charles III to strip Andrew of his royal titles, signaling a broader call for accountability within the House of Windsor.
title: Police Looking Into Whether Prince Andrew Enlisted Officer to Dig Up Dirt on Accuser Giuffre
